column1: Hearing from business owners helps us be better leaders. Thanks to Mayor Soriano in Parsippany and our leaders in Livingston for joining me for small business walks this week. I will continue to fight for the COVID relief our small businesses need. https://t.co/JXaH4sXj9I

Picked up breakfast at @sorriso_kitchen this morning on Main Street in Chatham and was grateful to hear from owners Jimmy and Karen Bellas about the ongoing needs of our small businesses as the COVID pandemic continues. Thank you to Mayor Thad Kobylarz for joining me! https://t.co/gW1yiC6Rqy

Suicide prevention and awareness are more critical than ever right now as people struggle with the isolation and stress related to COVID. And Len's willingness to share his story and to channel his experience into helping others is inspiring. https://t.co/BNn3Pp6CSt

We received news that our child care provider received a positive COVID-19 test. She’s doing well and we hope she has a speedy recovery. Everyone in our family has tested negative however we’ll be quarantining according to CDC guidelines.

A4: There’s a lot on the line this year: COVID response healthcare gun safety the environment tax relief reproductive freedom and more. Voting is power & your voice matters. We need to elect candidates up & down the ballot who will work hard for you and your family. #ELGOTV https://t.co/gdSLYYa4gm

A3: Too many New Jerseyans are concerned about their future and every vote I take is with them in mind. During my first term I’ve fought hard for NJ families to pass COVID relief legislation protect healthcare provide tax relief and support veterans. #ELGOTV https://t.co/ICL060wE6L

The key to containing the spread of this virus is quick turn around times for COVID test results. That's why I introduced the SPEEDY Act which incentivizes labs to produce faster test results. https://t.co/XTmmRYlXlB

When it comes to helping small businesses during COVID-19 addressing HABs at Lake Hopatcong or protecting the jobs at Picatinny Arsenal I have always sought to bring people together at all levels of government in service to our community and I’ll continue to do just that.

Quick turnaround for testing is a cornerstone of pandemic response. I introduced legislation today to encourage faster results by tying federal reimbursement to COVID-19 test result times so we can improve our public and economic health. https://t.co/Magg2OPqX0

The Child Care for Economic Recovery Act ✅ helps to bring quality child care to support ongoing employment ✅ provides tax credits to support child care providers affected by COVID-19 closures ✅ Allows many low-& middle-income families to claim the CDCTC credit for the 1st time
As a working mother of four I know how essential child care is for families. The COVID-19 pandemic has only exacerbated the child care crisis that already existed in America.

I am proud to have the endorsement of @32BJSEIU. The women and men of 32BJ have been on the front lines during COVID. I'll continue to fight to support essential workers in COVID response legislation. https://t.co/6mUIpShCeT

Union membership has improved the quality of life for generations of Americans. I know that's the case for my own family. We have so much to thank union leaders organizers & workers for this Labor Day especially our essential workers keeping our communities safe during COVID. https://t.co/1NGPNMb5Ja

Confronted with the challenges of COVID-19 Family Promise of Morris County has provided increased services for those experiencing housing insecurity and homelessness. Dominique Tornabe shared a message about the important work Family Promise does ⬇️ https://t.co/G18mEMtH9C

I am so grateful for volunteers like Roberta Alex and Mary for taking the time to mobilize voters. COVID-19 makes phonebanking even more critical. Join Team Mikie by signing up at the link below.  https://t.co/IapLc6NOyA https://t.co/jZ0BNpurg3

Click here for locations times and the items requested: https://t.co/pQqIebUwnm  You can also fill out the form if you can't make it to a drop-off but would like to arrange a socially-distant pick up with #TeamMikie. Stay tuned for more updates on the August Month of Service!

COVID-19 has tested New Jersey over the past few months. But we have also seen incredible examples of how this community looks out for each other. We are going to harness that can-do Jersey attitude with an #AugustMonthofService. https://t.co/PtAXMYQ8zV

Exploiting those in need right now is disgraceful. That's why I'm proud to have partnered with my colleagues on the Regional Recovery Task Force to introduce the COVID-19 SCAM Act. This bill will enable the FTC to take action again COVID-19 scam calls. https://t.co/9AoCEe1XTY

NJ has a fighter in @PascrellforNJ and I'm lucky to serve Passaic County with him in Congress. He is a strong advocate for issues that matter most to New Jerseyans: COVID-19 relief repealing the SALT cap and building Gateway. I'm proud to endorse him for re-election.  📸 2018 https://t.co/d5F5gH1LIP

With more children online with access to new apps and websites due to COVID-19 we need to be especially vigilant in order to protect them from potential abuse. @NJ_Coalition has a useful page of resources to help parents during this challenging time.  https://t.co/tsysOA244U

Ready to hear about funding for the infrastructure project that would get the biggest bang for the buck put the most people back to work and be an economic boon to the area of the country hardest hit by COVID-19:  The Gateway Tunnel Project. https://t.co/6iWH2tmpqK
They knew I was a wonder.   Sylvia Goldsholl 108 years old just made it through COVID-19. That's some New Jersey grit if I've ever seen it!  https://t.co/eps67YaQF9

One of the two new @NJRedCross plasma collection sites is located right here in Fairfield. If you’ve recovered from #COVID_19 please consider helping others by donating.  ➡️ Learn more: https://t.co/fcMRWmMRm3 https://t.co/3sdd03ZMsX
Thank you @JerseyCares  for your incredible work in helping others in #NJ11 — from providing volunteer opportunities to supporting nonprofit associations during #COVID19.  https://t.co/hvBlqwfzq7
Happy World Press Freedom Day! Thank you to all the journalists who work hard every day to keep us informed — especially about COVID-19.

If you or someone you know has recovered from COVID-19 this is a great way to help others. If you haven't had COVID-19 hospitals are in critical need of regular blood donations as well. https://t.co/GI0w6QKu6l

New York and New Jersey account for 45% of COVID-19 cases in the US and yet we only received about 9% of hospital funding. I spoke with @Cheddar on Friday about why more funds need to be allocated to New Jersey in the fight against #COVID19. https://t.co/MBu9E3jPY5
☎️ 2-1-1 has been activated in NJ to help take calls about #COVID19. You can also sign up for text alerts ⬇️ https://t.co/2uReMlaGIB

Thank you to everyone on #TeamMikie who worked to collect signatures and get Mikie's name on the ballot. In light of public health concerns regarding coronavirus (COVID-19) we are taking down all remaining canvassing events for the month out of an abundance of caution.

Want to help prevent the spread of #COVID19? Here’s what the CDC suggests:  🤒 Avoid close contact with people who are sick  🤧 Cover your cough or sneeze with a tissue  🚫 Avoid touching your eyes nose & mouth  🏘️ Stay home when you are sick
